title: NixOS Package PRs for wireplumber
description: NixOS Package PRs for wireplumber on GitHub

items.content_html:
I'm packaging wireplumber for NixOS (nixpkgs), and it uses this library. With this change, meson is able to just discover cpptoml via typical pkg-config mechanisms. I'm going to carry this patch for now.

Thanks!
items.title: cmake: output cpptoml.pc for pkg-config discoverability

items.title: flake.lock: Updating 'nixpkgs (NixOS/nixpkgs)' - 08ef0f28 -> c984213d

items.content_html:
Depends on #516 and #522. Based on #445.

Continuing work on pine64-pinephonepro.

This is intended to be used with the guided installer (#522).

Compared to #445 (at time of writing)

Behind:

  • Commits unrelated to PPP removed.

Ahead:

  • kernel 5.16.7 -> 5.17.9
  • kernel patch to fix pipewire/wireplumber segfault in libcamera
  • kernel patch to wake from suspend on phone call
  • kernel patch for pine64 keyboard case
  • kernel configuration needed for functional firewall
  • now uses #516 for managing UCM profiles
  • pipewire gets UCM profiles
  • kernel config to get waydroid working with networking (with hardware accel if you use lineageOS 18.1+)

Tested working

  • GPU
  • Audio playback/recording (pipewire and pulse both)
  • Wifi
  • Bluetooth
  • Mobile data
  • GPS (need to inject assistance data, poor reception likely a result of poor antenna/hardware)
  • Suspend
  • Making calls
  • Recieving calls
  • Recieving calls from suspend (usually works. Not 100% reliable, but that's probably a userspace problem.)
  • Sending texts
  • Recieving texts
  • Touch screen
  • Notification LED
  • Power/volup/voldown buttons
  • Cameras (Awaiting kernel support in cross-distro kernel)
  • Accelerometer/Gyroscope mpu6500
  • Geo Magnetic Sensor af8133j (Awaiting kernel support in cross-distro kernel)
  • Ambient light sensor stk3311 (Unknown, kernel driver enabled, I don't have /sys/bus/iio device for it)
  • pine64 keyboard accessory
  • Charging reliably (though for keyboard case you need to run echo 1500000 > /sys/class/power_supply/rk818-usb/input_current_limit https://xnux.eu/pinephone-keyboard/faq.html)
  • waydroid
  • Flashlight
  • Vibrate motor
  • firewall

TODO

  • README
  • release.nix build installer?
  • mobile.documentation.hydraOutputs? (see devices/pine64-pinephone/default.nix)

menuconfig note

I needed the following patch to make menuconfig work. This is not commited as I assume it may break other devices:

diff --git a/overlay/mobile-nixos/kernel/builder.nix b/overlay/mobile-nixos/kernel/builder.nix
index 4c72aeab..caad9931 100644
--- a/overlay/mobile-nixos/kernel/builder.nix
+++ b/overlay/mobile-nixos/kernel/builder.nix
@@ -539,7 +539,8 @@ stdenv.mkDerivation (inputArgs // {
     menuconfig = kernelDerivation.overrideAttrs({nativeBuildInputs ? [] , ...}: {
       nativeBuildInputs = nativeBuildInputs ++ [
         ncurses
-        pkg-config-helper
+        ncurses.dev
+        pkg-config
       ];
       buildFlags = [ "nconfig" "V=1" ];
 
@@ -547,14 +548,6 @@ stdenv.mkDerivation (inputArgs // {
       buildPhase = ''
         (PS4=" $ "; set -x
 
-        # Hot fixes pkg-config use.
-        export PKG_CONFIG_PATH="${buildPackages.ncurses.dev}/lib/pkg-config"
-        if [ -e scripts/kconfig/nconf-cfg.sh ]; then
-          sed -i"" \
-            -e 's/$(pkg-config --libs $PKG)/-L $(pkg-config --variable=libdir ncursesw) $(pkg-config --libs $PKG)/' \
-            scripts/kconfig/nconf-cfg.sh
-        fi
-
         cat >> scripts/kconfig/Makefile <<EOF
 
         run-nconfig:
